question.body: Which of the following is true about action potentials, but not graded potentials?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Graded potentials change in strength but action potential does not change in strength as it travels along axon.
Incorrect. Action potentials are all excitatory.
Correct. The trigger zone has many voltage-gated channels that can start the action potential and they are also involved in the propagation of action potential on axon.

part.hint: Graded potentials are also known as local potentials that can initiate the propagation of an action potential that travels one direction from trigger zone to axon terminal very quickly.
